Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Support for encoding

On a related note, decoding a byte-at-a-time is also troublesome because
there are characters that require not only more than one byte, but also
more than one Java character!  The culprit: surrogate pairs.

For a quick description:

  http://www.orbeon.com/blog/2006/06/10/unicode-in-java-not-so-fast/

I ran into some rare cases in some previous work where iterating
through a Java String a character at a time produced some odd results
due to the presence of surrogate pairs in the String.  We wound up
finding a solution that didn't require character-at-a-time iteration
through the String.

I don't know if we've run into problems with surrogate pairs, but as
long as we're talking about going through a String a
character-at-a-time, I thought I'd mention it as a piece of broken
glass to watch out for.

Aaron
